page.title: 01Introduction to Hornby.
page.content: The village of Hornby is situated in the Lune Valley. The River Wenning flows through Hornby to join the Lune one km. West of the village. The A683 Lancaster to Kirkby Lonsdale road follows the course of the Lune and passes through Hornby 15 km. NE of Lancaster. The Hornby area is an agricultural one, mainly given over to dairy farming though sheep are grazed on the higher slopes of the fairly steep, partially wooded valley sides. The small village of Gressingham on the opposite bank of the River Lune has stone built housing clustered around the village church. Farms are situated around the two settlements.Hornby has two churches, two hotels, a Primary and Secondary School, four shops, a Village Institute and a motor business. The village is dominated by Hornby Castle.
